results.title: To kill a mockingbird by Harper Lee. The Miracle worker by William Gibson
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “I couldn’t put it down - hooked on books. Classroom classics”.
The two parts of this video use clips from films of the books to illustrate their themes and discussion points “To kill a mockingbird” depicts life in a small Southern United States town during the depression, through the eyes of a six year old girl whose father is defending a Negro in a rape trial. The novel deals with courage, prejudice and the people and events that shape our lives. “The Miracle worker” tells the true story of the early life of Helen Keller, blind and deaf, through illness and the attempts of a young girl, Annie Sullivan to discipline her and develop her abilities. Teachers notes accompany the video.

results.title: To kill a child
results.brief_description: Road safety film. Introduces, with apparent casualness, a young couple about to set off on a motoring trip and a little girl at play. Happy and relaxed, they are planning to make the most of a fine day. A few minutes later the child is dead and the holiday makers numb with shock. The very lack of sensationalism makes the events seem real, leaving one with a sense of lives devastated without warning by pointless, avoidable tragedy.

results.title: To hell and back. Dr. Bavandra interview.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
This video contains two programs from the Four Corners series. 1. To hell and back - schizophrenics talk about what it means to be a schizophrenic attempting to live in society. Treatment with drugs is discussed and the need for support from others is stressed. 2. Dr. Bavandra interview - Dr. Timotei Bavandra is interviewed about the coup in Fiji.

results.title: To hear or not to hear
results.creator_credit: Jeff Osment, Green Hill Films and Jill Mansfield
results.brief_description: A domestic scene is enacted twice - once from the perspective of a busy woman preparing a meal and then as seen by her partially deaf husband. Gives insights into the frustrations of both.

results.title: To everything there is a season
results.creator_credit: Bosisto Productions, South Australian Film Corporation and Brian Bosisto
results.brief_description: A general interest film exposing one of South Australia’s wildlife sanctuaries located at the Coorong. It instructively illustrates the interaction between the birds and the landscape against a backdrop of seasonal change. Of particular interest to students of the life sciences, conservationists and bird-watching societies. Narrated by John and Judith Dick.

results.title: To each a rightful share
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, Donald Fraser and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
This, to the privileged, is a fine-sounding principle; but to the underprivileged it is a call to action. Riots in Africa, India’s violence, China’s new dynamism, Japan’s intense industrialization - all these are seen as part of a great movement. Good historical overview of the rise of industrialization, with particular emphasis on the social affects (the growth in wealth brought on by industrialization).
